content:
MsmqTransportBindingElement Class

In this Article

Represents the binding element used to specify the queuing communication properties for a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service that uses the native Message Queuing (MSMQ) protocol.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class MsmqTransportBindingElement : System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqBindingElementBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • BindingElement
  • TransportBindingElement
  • System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqBindingElementBase
  • MsmqTransportBindingElement

Inherited Members

Remarks

The MsmqTransportBindingElement enables the user to set the properties of the queued communication channel. The queued communication channel uses Message Queuing for its transport.

This binding element is the default binding element used by the Message Queuing standard binding (NetMsmqBinding).

Constructors summary

MsmqTransportBindingElement()

Initializes a new instance of the MsmqTransportBindingElement class.

Properties summary

MaxPoolSize

Gets or sets an integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing (MSMQ) message objects.
QueueTransferProtocol

Gets or sets an enumeration value that indicates the queued communication channel transport that this binding uses.
Scheme

Returns a String that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.
UseActiveDirectory

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory.

Methods summary

BuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(BindingContext)

Builds a channel factory using the context provided.
BuildChannelListener<TChannel>(BindingContext)

Builds a channel listener using the context provided.
CanBuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(BindingContext)

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether you can build a channel factory with the context provided.
CanBuildChannelListener<TChannel>(BindingContext)

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether you can build a channel listener with the context provided.
Clone()

Returns a clone of the binding element.

Constructors

  • MsmqTransportBindingElement()

    Initializes a new instance of the MsmqTransportBindingElement class.

    public MsmqTransportBindingElement ();

    Example

                    MsmqTransportBindingElement transportBindingElement = new MsmqTransportBindingElement();

Properties

  • MaxPoolSize

    Gets or sets an integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing (MSMQ) message objects.

    public int MaxPoolSize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing message objects.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value is less than zero.

    Remarks

    The internal Message Queuing message object pool is used to avoid allocations of these objects when sending and receiving messages. The maximum pool size is a performance-tuning parameter. The default value is 8.

    Example

                MsmqTransportBindingElement transportBindingElement = new MsmqTransportBindingElement();
            transportBindingElement.MaxPoolSize = 5;
  • QueueTransferProtocol

    Gets or sets an enumeration value that indicates the queued communication channel transport that this binding uses.

    public System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol QueueTransferProtocol { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • QueueTransferProtocol

      A QueueTransferProtocol enumeration value that indicates the transport used for message delivery between queue managers.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value is not one of the QueueTransferProtocol values.

    Remarks

    Message Queuing (MSMQ) does not support Active Directory addressing when using SOAP Reliable Messaging Protocol (SRMP), so do not set QueueTransferProtocol to QueueTransferProtocol or QueueTransferProtocol when UseActiveDirectory is set to true.

    Example

                MsmqTransportBindingElement transportBindingElement = new MsmqTransportBindingElement();
            transportBindingElement.QueueTransferProtocol = QueueTransferProtocol.Native;
  • Scheme

    Returns a String that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.

    public override string Scheme { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.

    Remarks

    The Scheme property returns the string "net.msmq".

    The Message Queuing (MSMQ) queued transport supports several addressing schemes, including net.msmq.

    Example

                MsmqTransportBindingElement transportBindingElement = new MsmqTransportBindingElement();
            string scheme = transportBindingElement.Scheme;
  • UseActiveDirectory

    Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory.

    public bool UseActiveDirectory { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Message Queuing (MSMQ) queue addresses can consist of path names or direct format names. With a direct format name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using DNS, NetBIOS, or IP. With a path name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using Active Directory.

    By default, the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) queued transport converts the URI of a message queue to a direct format name. By setting the UseActiveDirectory property to true, an application can specify that the queued transport should resolve the computer name using Active Directory rather than DNS, NetBIOS, or IP.

    Example

                MsmqTransportBindingElement transportBindingElement = new MsmqTransportBindingElement();
            transportBindingElement.UseActiveDirectory = true;

Methods

  • BuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(BindingContext)

    Builds a channel factory using the context provided.

    public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory<TChannel> BuildChannelFactory<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      BindingContext

      The BindingContext with which to build the channel factory.

    Returns

    • IChannelFactory

      A Message Queuing (MSMQ) channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing Message Queuing applications.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The context value is null.

    • ArgumentException

      The TChannel is not IOutputChannel or IOutputSessionChannel.

    • InvalidOperationException

      MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is EncryptAndSign and UseActiveDirectory is false.

    Remarks

    A channel factory is created and initialized using the properties that have been set in the binding element. The initialized channel factory is then used to create output channels that can be used to send messages to a message queue.

    Example

                transportBindingElement.BuildChannelFactory<IOutputChannel>(context);
  • BuildChannelListener<TChannel>(BindingContext)

    Builds a channel listener using the context provided.

    public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener<TChannel> BuildChannelListener<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) where TChannel : class, System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel;

    Parameters

    • context
      BindingContext

      The BindingContext with which to build the channel listener.

    Returns

    • IChannelListener

      A Message Queuing (MSMQ) channel listener that can be used to create channels to receive messages from existing MSMQ applications.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The context value is null.

    • ArgumentException

      The TChannel is not IInputChannel or IInputSessionChannel.

    • InvalidOperationException

      MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode is Certificate or WindowsDomain and MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is None.

    Example

                transportBindingElement.BuildChannelListener<IInputChannel>(context);
  • CanBuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(BindingContext)

    Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether you can build a channel factory with the context provided.

    public override bool CanBuildChannelFactory<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      BindingContext

      The BindingContext with which to build the channel factory.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if you can build a channel factory with the context provided; otherwise, false. The binding element returns true only when TChannel is IOutputChannel or IOutputSessionChannel.

    Example

                if (transportBindingElement.CanBuildChannelFactory<IOutputChannel>(context))
            {
                // Do something...
            }
  • CanBuildChannelListener<TChannel>(BindingContext)

    Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether you can build a channel listener with the context provided.

    public override bool CanBuildChannelListener<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) where TChannel : class, System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel;

    Parameters

    • context
      BindingContext

      The BindingContext with which to build the channel listener.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if you can build a channel listener with the context provided; otherwise, false.

      The binding returns true only when TChannel is IInputChannel or IInputSessionChannel.

    Example

                if (transportBindingElement.CanBuildChannelListener<IInputChannel>(context))
            {
                // Do something...
            }
  • Clone()

    Returns a clone of the binding element.

    public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement Clone ();

    Returns

    • BindingElement

      A clone of the binding element.

    Example

                MsmqTransportBindingElement transportBindingElement = new MsmqTransportBindingElement();
            BindingElement bindingElement = transportBindingElement.Clone();
